_header: Saint Thomas the holy man under the earth lay
_description: The Translation of St. Thomas of Canterbury — seventy-four lines (appendix to the Life of St. Thomas in the South English Legendary)

BodAsh43.First Lines:
Seynt Thomas þis holi mon vnder erþe laiAr he ischrined
                    were mony along dai…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou ihesu for þe swete loue þat seynt Thomas on
                    þoȝteBringe ous to þulke Ioie þat he so dere
                    abouȝte

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
Seint thomas þis holi man onder eorþe he layAre þat
                    he ischrined were wel mani a long dai…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Nov Iesu crist for þulke loue þat Seint Thomas on
                    þouȝteȜyue us part of þulke Ioie þat he so deore a
                    bouȝte
BodLauMis108.Note:
Continues after 6687 as
                    if part of same text.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayne Thomas þis haly man vnder erth he layOr þat he
                    schriuede was ful many a longe dayffor he lay neghen & fourty ȝere
                    & halfe a ȝere in erth þor& aboute viij dayes als so or
                    he of erth taken wore…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Now swete ihesu for thomas lufe þat þe had ay in
                    thoghtBrynge vs til þat ilk ioy þat he ful dere has
                    boght
